actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.

official_title: A bill to help reduce the cost of credit to farmers by providing relief from antiquated and unnecessary regulatory burdens for the Farm Credit System, and for other purposes.
short_title: Farm Credit System Regulatory Relief Act of 1995

summary.text: Farm Credit System Regulatory Relief Act of 1995 - Amends the Farm Credit Act of 1971 to extend the length of time between required Farm Credit Administration examinations of Farm Credit System (FCS) institutions. (Sec. 5) Directs the Farm Credit System Insurance Corporation (FCSIC) to allocate Farm Credit Insurance Fund excess interest earnings to FCS banks. (Sec. 6) Requires FCSIC to implement the least-cost alternative, including liquidation, in providing assistance to troubled FCS banks. (Sec. 8) States that FCSIC may not act as conservator or receiver of a FCS institution. (Sec. 9) Grants FCSIC exclusive authority to examine a FCS institution whose charter has been canceled. (Sec. 10) Sets forth specified FCSIC oversight and regulatory authority, including regulation of golden parachute and indemnification payments. (Sec. 11) Permits FCS associations to establish administrative service entities. (Sec. 12) Sets forth specified requirements for secondary market loan sales, including borrowers' rights. (Sec. 13) Revises certain paperwork, private sector certification, and operating provisions.

titles.title: Farm Credit System Regulatory Relief Act of 1995
A bill to help reduce the cost of credit to farmers by providing relief from antiquated and unnecessary regulatory burdens for the Farm Credit System, and for other purposes.
